idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
import random  # For adding variation to notes and rhythms


def set_mood_params(mood):
    if mood.lower() == 'down':
        chords = [[60, 63, 67], [65, 68, 72], [67, 71, 74]]  # C minor: i, iv, V (soothing triads)
        tempo = 60  # Slow tempo for calming effect
        scale = [60, 62, 63, 65, 67, 68, 70, 72]  # C minor scale
        volume = 90  # Velocity (0-127) for soft
        drum_intensity = 70  # Lower for gentle
    beat_duration = 60 / tempo  # 1 second per beat at tempo=60, for slow, relaxing pace
    return chords, tempo, scale, volume, drum_intensity, beat_duration

# Hardcode mood for this cell
mood = 'down'
chords, tempo, scale, volume, drum_intensity, beat_duration = set_mood_params(mood)
print("Playing Down Mood Music - Smooth chord version...")

# Simulate layers sequentially for smoother flow: Drum + Melody + Harmony in balanced sequence
for i in range(32):  # Loop for ~30 second composition
    # Drum layer: Gentle, sparse beats (every few iterations)
    if i % 8 == 0:  # Slower drum pattern for down mood (every 8 beats, less intrusive)
        playNote(36, beats=beat_duration / 2, velocity=drum_intensity)  # Soft bass drum thump
        rest(beat_duration / 4)  # Minimal rest
    elif i % 4 == 0:
        playNote(42, beats=beat_duration / 4, velocity=drum_intensity * 0.8)  # Light hi-hat tap
        rest(beat_duration / 4)

    # Melody layer: Semi-structured with variation (not fully random for musicality)
    # Use cycling through scale with random offset for coherence
    base_note_index = i % len(scale)  # Cycle through scale for pattern
    note = scale[base_note_index] + 12 + random.randint(-2, 2)  # Octave up + small variation
    duration = random.choice([beat_duration / 2, beat_duration])  # Vary length slightly
    playNote(note, beats=duration, velocity=volume)
    rest(duration / 4)  # Short rest only, to connect notes smoothly

    # Harmony layer: Use playNote with list for sustained, blended chord sound
    if i % 4 == 0:  # Every 4 beats, add chord background
        chord_notes = random.choice(chords)
        playNote(chord_notes, beats=beat_duration * 2, velocity=volume * 0.7)  # Play full chord as list, longer duration for sustain
        rest(beat_duration / 4)  # Minimal rest to keep continuity

idata.python:
import random  # For adding variation to notes and rhythms


def set_mood_params(mood):
    if mood.lower() == 'down':
        chords = [[60, 63, 67], [65, 68, 72], [67, 71, 74]]  # C minor: i, iv, V (soothing triads)
        tempo = 60  # Slow tempo for calming effect
        scale = [60, 62, 63, 65, 67, 68, 70, 72]  # C minor scale
        volume = 90  # Velocity (0-127) for soft
        drum_intensity = 70  # Lower for gentle
    beat_duration = 60 / tempo  # 1 second per beat at tempo=60, for slow, relaxing pace
    return chords, tempo, scale, volume, drum_intensity, beat_duration

# Hardcode mood for this cell
mood = 'down'
chords, tempo, scale, volume, drum_intensity, beat_duration = set_mood_params(mood)
print("Playing Down Mood Music - Smooth chord version...")

# Simulate layers sequentially for smoother flow: Drum + Melody + Harmony in balanced sequence
for i in range(32):  # Loop for ~30 second composition
    # Drum layer: Gentle, sparse beats (every few iterations)
    if i % 8 == 0:  # Slower drum pattern for down mood (every 8 beats, less intrusive)
        playNote(36, beats=beat_duration / 2, velocity=drum_intensity)  # Soft bass drum thump
        rest(beat_duration / 4)  # Minimal rest
    elif i % 4 == 0:
        playNote(42, beats=beat_duration / 4, velocity=drum_intensity * 0.8)  # Light hi-hat tap
        rest(beat_duration / 4)

    # Melody layer: Semi-structured with variation (not fully random for musicality)
    # Use cycling through scale with random offset for coherence
    base_note_index = i % len(scale)  # Cycle through scale for pattern
    note = scale[base_note_index] + 12 + random.randint(-2, 2)  # Octave up + small variation
    duration = random.choice([beat_duration / 2, beat_duration])  # Vary length slightly
    playNote(note, beats=duration, velocity=volume)
    rest(duration / 4)  # Short rest only, to connect notes smoothly

    # Harmony layer: Use playNote with list for sustained, blended chord sound
    if i % 4 == 0:  # Every 4 beats, add chord background
        chord_notes = random.choice(chords)
        playNote(chord_notes, beats=beat_duration * 2, velocity=volume * 0.7)  # Play full chord as list, longer duration for sustain
        rest(beat_duration / 4)  # Minimal rest to keep continuity
